item.title: Making it save character files when loggin out
item.dc:creator: @1234ideclareathumbwa 1234ideclareathumbwar
item.description:
@1234ideclareathumbwa wrote:

No, search for the method that saves the character …If i’m not mistaken, it should be something like

saveCharacterInfo();

or

saveChar();
saveCharacter();

Damn I forgot.

When you have it, in your logout() method put the method name in for example saveC();

item.title: Making it save character files when loggin out
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

[quote=“bakatool, post:2, topic:155012”]all servers really got this already… even dodian server i released

its in PlayerHandler near
if Player.disconnected()
removePlayer§;

and removePlayer has saving call to save game[/quote]

Yah, I think my server has it, but I doesn’t work, because when I log out, the server window says, Could not save +playername+ and Could not save moreinfo +playername+… and the +playername+ is whoever…[br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2007, 02:29:49 AM[/size][hr]Heres my disconnect code I think

[code]if(players[i].disconnected) {
for(int i2 = 0; i2 < server.npcHandler.maxNPCs; i2++) {
if(server.npcHandler.npcs[i2] != null && players[i] != null) {
if(server.npcHandler.npcs[i2].followPlayer == players[i].playerId && server.npcHandler.npcs[i2] != null)
server.npcHandler.npcs[i2].IsDead = true;
}
}

			if(client.AutoSave == true) {
			if(saveGame(players[i])) {
				System.out.println("Game saved for player "+players[i].playerName);
			} else {
				System.out.println("Could not save for "+players[i].playerName);
			};
			client.AutoSave = false;
		}[/code]

But after I see more saving related things I think…

if (players[i].savefile == true) { if(saveGame(players[i])){ playerCount--; savechar(players[i]); System.out.println("Game saved for player "+players[i].playerName); } else { System.out.println("Could not save for "+players[i].playerName); }; } else { System.out.println("Did not save for "+players[i].playerName); } removePlayer(players[i]); players[i] = null; } }

Read full topic
